[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/transaction_info/mod.rs] [Function: decode_value()] [Zero hash injection] Can an attacker inject all-zeros HashValue into TransactionInfo fields, potentially colliding with uninitialized or default state? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/transaction_info/mod.rs] [Function: encode_value()] [Hash canonicalization] Are HashValue fields canonicalized before serialization, or can different representations of the same hash value cause BCS encoding ambiguity? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/transaction_info/mod.rs] [Function: decode_value()] [Gas overflow] Can gas_used field overflow during deserialization if attacker provides u64::MAX value, causing integer wraparound in gas accounting? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/transaction_info/mod.rs] [Function: encode_value()] [Negative gas] Can gas_used be encoded with invalid values (through BCS manipulation) that appear negative when type-cast, enabling gas refund exploits? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/transaction_info/mod.rs] [Function: decode_value()] [Gas inconsistency] Can gas_used in TransactionInfo mismatch the actual gas charged to accounts, allowing validators to extract fees without recording them? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/transaction_info/mod.rs] [Function: decode_value()] [Status enum attack] Can an attacker inject invalid ExecutionStatus enum discriminants during BCS deserialization, causing undefined behavior in status handling? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/transaction_info/mod.rs] [Function: encode_value()] [Success/failure flip] Can ExecutionStatus be modified from Success to Failure (or vice versa) without invalidating the transaction_hash, enabling state manipulation? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/transaction_info/mod.rs] [Function: decode_value()] [Auxiliary info injection] Can an attacker inject auxiliary_info_hash when it should be None according to protocol rules, causing downstream systems to process phantom auxiliary data? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/transaction_info/mod.rs] [Function: encode_value()] [Auxiliary hash mismatch] Can auxiliary_info_hash be set without corresponding PersistedAuxiliaryInfo in storage, breaking the invariant linking these schemas? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/transaction_info/mod.rs] [Schema: TransactionInfoSchema] [Version migration] If TransactionInfo is upgraded from V0 to V1, can old nodes crash when encountering new format, causing network partition? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/transaction_info/mod.rs] [Function: decode_value()] [Backward compatibility] Does BCS deserialization handle TransactionInfo enum variants backward-compatibly, or can new variants break old nodes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/transaction_info/mod.rs] [Schema: TransactionInfoSchema] [Prefix attack] Can an attacker exploit RocksDB prefix compression to cause Version keys to be decoded incorrectly, returning wrong TransactionInfo? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/transaction_info/mod.rs] [Schema: TransactionInfoSchema] [Bloom filter bypass] Can crafted Version keys bypass RocksDB bloom filters, causing excessive disk I/O and performance degradation during lookups? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/transaction_info/mod.rs] [Schema: TransactionInfoSchema] [SST file corruption] Can corrupted SST files in TRANSACTION_INFO_CF_NAME return invalid data without triggering checksum errors? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/transaction_info/mod.rs] [Function: encode_key()] [Version zero] Does encode_key() handle version 0 correctly, or can it be confused with None/null causing genesis transaction to be inaccessible? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/transaction_info/mod.rs] [Function: decode_value()] [Empty value] Can TransactionInfo be stored with empty/zero-length value, bypassing BCS deserialization and causing subsequent reads to fail? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/transaction_info/mod.rs] [Schema: TransactionInfoSchema] [Metadata corruption] Can DbMetadataKey::TransactionInfoPrunerProgress be corrupted to point beyond actual stored versions, causing pruner to delete valid data? (High)
